question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Although the atmosphere was hostile, the meeting ended on ..........terms.
explanation:
Hostile; showing or feeling opposition or dislike; unfriendly.

Amicable; having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

The company had to.......the restaurant in order to construct a hotel
explanation:
construct; build or make (something, typically a building, road, or machine).

Demolish; pull or knock down (a building).

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Five years ago the economy of our country was buoyant but nowadays it has become...........
explanation:
For something to be distressed, it is suffering from extreme anxiety, sorrow, pain or setback. 

A buoyant economy is a successful one in which there is a lot of trade and economic activity.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

We enjoy real stories not those that are.........
explanation:
Real; actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact; not imagined or supposed.

Imaginary; existing only in the imagination.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Ann's efficiency earned her a promotion while Jane's ...........caused her dismissal.
explanation:
Efficiency; able to accomplish something with the least waste of time and effort

Incompetence; inability to do something successfully; ineptitude.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

While Rashida's business is flourishing, Ida's is.............
explanation:
flourishing; developing rapidly and successfully; thriving.

Declining;becoming smaller, fewer, or less; decreasing.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

In those societies, the ............and the cultured lived together.
explanation:
Cultured; characterized by refined taste and manners and good education.

Barbaric; primitive; unsophisticated.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

The contributions should be ...........not compulsory
explanation:
compulsory; involving or exercising compulsion; coercive, force

voluntary; done, given, or acting of one's own free will.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Some people live in abject poverty while others live in ..............
explanation: Affluence; the state of having a great deal of money; wealth.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

When you...........someone's point of view, you should do so politely.
explanation:
Refute; prove (a statement or theory) to be wrong or false; disprove.

When you refute someone's point of view, you should do so politely.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

One should ...........the land very well if one expects a bumper harvest
explanation:
cultivate; prepare and use (land) for crops or gardening.

One should cultivate the land very well if one expects a bumper harvest

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

His lecture was.............and so the students did not understand it.
explanation:
Indefinite; lasting for an unknown or unstated length of time

His lecture was indefinite and so the students did not understand it.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

In Botany, one is bound to........flowers
explanation: In Botany, one is bound to study flowers

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Harry cannot do without his...........of short stories because he loves reading.
explanation:
collection; a group of things or people.

Harry cannot do without his collection of short stories because he loves reading.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Can you............the result of tomorrow's match?
explanation:
predict; is a guess, sometimes based on facts or evidence, but not always.

Can you predict the result of tomorrow's match?

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The river..........across the plain
explanation:
Meandered; (of a river or road) follow a winding course.

The river meandered across the plain

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Since the army was no longer needed, it was ...............
explanation:
Disbanded; to dissolve or cause to part ways

Since the army was no longer needed, it was disbanded

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

It is most...........that the company spent five million naira on that fragile fence
explanation:
Astonishing; extremely surprising or impressive; amazing.

It is most astonishing that the company spent five million naira on that fragile fence

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Matters that are confidential must not be made..........
explanation: Matters that are confidential must not be made public

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
The boy went scot-free even though he insulted his teacher. This means that the boy was
explanation: To escape from a situation without receiving the punishment you deserve

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
The driver escaped death by a hair's breadth. This means that the driver escaped death
explanation: Very close or a narrow escape

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
I am given a free hand to run this business. This means that I
explanation: If someone gives you a free hand, they give you the freedom to use your own judgment and to do exactly as you wish
options: am allowed to make my own decisions

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
In every good transaction, there should be some give-and-take. This means that
explanation: The exchange of mutual compromise or concession
options: any gift should be accepted willingly
people should be willing to make compromises

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
That account of the incident is true to a degree. This means that the account is
explanation: To indicate that something is partly true, but not entirely true.

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
Moses won the contest hands down. This means that Moses won
explanation: winning with ease or with little or no effort

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
They vowed to win the race by hook or by crook. This means that they vowed to win by
explanation: By any means necessary

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
They vowed to win the race by hook or by crook. This means that they vowed to win by
explanation: By any means necessary

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.

They vowed to win the race by hook or by crook. This means that they vowed to win by
explanation: By any means necessary

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.

William spent the first three months learning the ropes. This means that he
explanation: If you are learning the ropes, you are learning how a particular task or job is done.
options: pulled all the ropes that should be pulled

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.

Our teacher advised us not to go with the crowd. This means that he advised us not to
explanation: To do what everyone else is doing.
options: stay too much in the crowd

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.

Although the men were foreigners, they were given preferential treatment. This means that the men were treated
explanation: When you give someone preferential treatment, it gives the person you prefer an advantage over everyone else. You treat and favour them above others.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

John bled profusely as a result of the accident
explanation: profusely; to a great degree; in large amounts.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

What you are suggesting is not feasible
explanation: Feasible; in this context feasible means, something that is workable, practical, achievable.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

Pa Bakary augmented his income by selling firewood
explanation: Augmented; having been made greater in size or value.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

He plays the kora with dexterity
explanation: Dexterity; skill in performing tasks, especially with the hands.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

The police could not apprehend all the gamblers
explanation: Apprehend; arrest (someone) for a crime.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

Fafa has a conspicuous nose
explanation:
conspicuous; attracting notice or attention.

prominent; important; famous.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

Many parents are upset by the laxity with which children treat academic work nowadays
explanation: Upset; make (someone) unhappy, disappointed, or worried.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

In order to keep the peace I had to retract my statement
explanation: Retract; to withdraw (a statement or accusation) as untrue or unjustified.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

Their father is so vigilant that it is not possible for his children to play truant
explanation: vigilant; keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties. watchful, observant.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word

The principal endorsed my travelling documents without delay.
explanation: Endorsed; To declare one's public approval or support of something or someone

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Please, run......fifty copies of this report for me
explanation:
Run off; To make photocopies.

Please, run off  fifty copies of this report for me

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

My father's seventieth birthday...........a celebration.
explanation: My father's seventieth birthday calls for.a celebration.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Kojo succeeded in passing his examination.................the odds he faced
explanation:
Despite; without being affected by; in spite of.

Kojo succeeded in passing his examination despite the odds he faced

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

If the police had not intervened quickly, the suspected thief..........by the mob.
explanation:
The phrase ''would have been killed'' means something had happened that prevented another thing (an unlikely bad event) from happening.

If the police had not intervened quickly, the suspected thief would have been killed by the mob.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Harry hates.............in suspense
explanation: Harry hates being kept in suspense

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
We are not bound to believe all .............He said
explanation: We are not bound to believe all  that He said

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
Margaret forgot to buy.................
explanation: Margaret forgot to buy a pair of trousers

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
He was charged...........stealing from the company's safe
explanation: He was charged with stealing from the company's safe

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The teacher had hardly turned his back...........the class became noisy
explanation: The teacher had hardly turned his back. when the class became noisy

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

This is Kunle's handwriting; there.....be no argument about it
explanation: This is Kunle's handwriting; there can be no argument about it

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

In Matamina no one is ..........the law
explanation:
Above; at a higher level or layer.

In Matamina no one is above the law

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Luckily, Frank arrived just..........time to catch the plane
explanation:
Just in time means that something happened just before it would have been too late

Luckily, Frank arrived just in time to catch the plane

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Those boys will have to blame..........for not listening to advice
explanation:
Themselves; used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a group of people or things previously mentioned as the subject of the clause.

Those boys will have to blame themselves for not listening to advice

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

This is not your book, it is .............
explanation: This is not your book, it is Andrew's

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

John said he had never .........insulted in his life
explanation:
Been is the past participle of the verb be.

John said he had never been so .insulted in his life

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

I asked Penda to stand...........for me since I could not attend the meeting
explanation:
When you stand in for someone, you are a representative.

I asked Penda to stand in for me since I could not attend the meeting

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Femi, Tom is Aka's son.........?
explanation:
We often use question tags when we expect the listener to agree with our statement. In this case, when the statement is positive, we use a negative question tag. Hence it would read;

Femi, Tom is Aka's son isn't he?

Since we are referring to a human being and the statement is gender-specific, the pronoun ''he'' will be used.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

You will help me lift this box..........?
explanation:
We often use question tags when we expect the listener to agree with our statement. In this case, when the statement is positive , we use a negative question tag. Hence it would read;

You will help me lift this box, won't you?

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Sally assisted me in buying my......yesterday
explanation: Sally assisted me in buying my very first party dress yesterday

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The cook had..........oil and so could not prepare the soup
explanation: Little; a small amount of.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The cook had ..........oil and so could not prepare the soup
explanation:
Little; a small amount of.

The cook had little oil and so could not prepare the soup

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

we will have to set up a............panel to investigate this matter
explanation: we will have to set up a seven-man panel to investigate this matter

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The workers could not move the heavy stone..............they tried
explanation:
This way "however" modifies "heavy", while "hard" means "the energy used" (which is stone, in this context.)  "however much" is adjectival

The workers could not move the heavy stone however hard they tried

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The friendly match will kick...........at 4,00 p.m. today as scheduled
explanation:
Kick off; (of a football match) be started or resumed by a player kicking the ball from the centre spot.

The friendly match will kick off at 4,00 p.m. today as scheduled

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The boys.........football when the teacher entered the class
explanation: The boys were discussing football when the teacher entered the class

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Our teacher is............to make such a mistake
explanation: Our teacher is much too intelligent to make such a mistake

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Some people find it difficult not to give........to temptation
explanation:
you give in to something when you cease fighting or arguing; admit defeat.

Some people find it difficult not to give in to temptation

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

If your argument is not strong enough, you...........your claim to your father's property
explanation: If your argument is not strong enough, you.will forfeit your claim to your father's property

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

While he was in prison he had.........time to read a lot of books.
explanation:
Ample; enough or more than enough; plentiful.

While he was in prison he had  ample time to read a lot of books.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Anyone who wants to succeed in any endeavour should.........his lazy habits
explanation:
shake off means to get rid of something bad

Anyone who wants to succeed in any endeavour should shake off his lazy habits.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:
No sooner had they arrived.............we left the hall
explanation:
If the second event occurs immediately after the first, we can express that idea using the structure no sooner … than. Note that in this structure no sooner introduces the event that occurred first

  • No sooner had I arrived at the station than the train came. (= I came first and the train arrived right after me.)
  • No sooner had we heard the noise than we rushed to the spot.
  • No sooner had she finished one project than she started working on the next.
  • No sooner had I closed my eyes than I fell asleep.

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

Any good newspaper will cater for the needs of the........public
explanation:
Reading public is that part of the population which regularly reads publications, articles etc.

Any good newspaper will cater for the needs of the reading .public

question:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences:

The little boy found it difficult to keep peace .......his father
explanation:
The preposition ''with'' is used to say that people or things are in a place together or are doing something together.

The little boy found it difficult to keep peace with his father

question: In question numbered 74 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Newsstand; a stand or stall for the sale of newspapers.

question: In question numbered 75 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: vendor; a person or company offering something for sale, especially a trader in the street.

question: In question numbered 76 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Editions; a particular form or version of a published text.

question: In question numbered 77 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: mastheads; a list of the names of the most important people involved in producing and writing for a magazine or newspaper

question: In question numbered 78 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Headlines; a heading at the top of an article or page in a newspaper or magazine.

question: In question numbered 79 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: captions; a title or brief explanation accompanying an illustration, cartoon, or poster.

question: In question numbered 80 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: columns; a regular section of a newspaper or magazine devoted to a particular subject or written by a particular person

question: In question numbered 81 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Editorials; a newspaper article expressing the editor's opinion on a topical issue.

question: In question numbered 82 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Articles; a piece of writing included with others in a newspaper, magazine, or other publication.

question: In question numbered 83 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: freelance; self-employed and hired to work for different companies on particular assignments.

question: In question numbered 84 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: obituaries; a notice of a death, especially in a newspaper, typically including a brief biography of the deceased person

question: In question numbered 85 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Sports; an activity involving physical exertion and skill in which an individual or team competes against another or others for entertainment.

question: In question numbered 86 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Resistance; the ability not to be affected by something, especially adversely.

question: In question numbered 87 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Lab technicians are skilled workers that work with complex systems or perform highly technical mechanical or diagnostic tests in medical or scientific laboratories.

question: In question numbered 88 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: sample; a small part or quantity intended to show what the whole is like.

question: In question numbered 89 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Carry; an act of carrying something from one place to another.

question: In question numbered 90 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Stage; a point, period, or step in a process or development.

question: In question numbered 91 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Inflammation; a localized physical condition in which part of the body becomes reddened, swollen, hot, and often painful, especially as a reaction to injury or infection.

question: In question numbered 91 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
In question numbered 92 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Telescope; an optical instrument designed to make distant objects appear nearer, containing an arrangement of lenses, or of curved mirrors and lenses, by which rays of light are collected and focused and the resulting image magnified.

question: In question numbered 93 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Organism; an individual animal, plant, or single-celled life form.

question: In question numbered 94 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: contagious; (of a disease) spread from one person or organism to another, typically by direct contact.

question: In question numbered 95 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Hygiene; conditions or practices conducive to maintaining health and preventing disease, especially through cleanliness.

question: In question numbered 96 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: washing; the action of washing oneself or laundering clothes, bed linen, etc.

question: In question numbered 97 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: prescription; an instruction written by a medical practitioner that authorizes a patient to be issued with a medicine or treatment.

question: In question numbered 98 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: pharmacist; a person who is professionally qualified to prepare and dispense medicinal drugs.

question: In question numbered 99 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Restore; bring back or re-establish (a previous right, practice, or situation).

question: In question numbered 100 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
explanation: Health; the state of being free from illness or injury.
